title: Misfits and Misdemeanours
abstract: Short films reflecting Scorsese's thematic: troubled men & boys, on the fringe, playing up & out of sorts.
description: The solo, often lonely, troubled man is a main theme traversing the breadth of Scorsese’s oeuvre. From Travis Bickle in ‘Taxi Driver’ to Rupert Pupkin in ‘The King of Comedy’ and Howard Hughes in ‘The Aviator’, loneliness is an integral theme of Martin Scorsese’s work. Ahead of the Essential Scorsese season, film critic and writer Joanna Di Mattia has written an in-depth look at how the subject is approached within his films. She writes: “Scorsese’s lonely men share a similar experience of masculinity – angry, troubled, and empty, exiled from the world, living on the edge of acceptability, afraid of humiliation, alone even when surrounded by others, seeking redemption as they struggle for humanity.”  This series of short form works pays homage to this thematic - troubled men and boys, on the fringe, playing up and out of sorts.
